00:00:15:000000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:15:000000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:16:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:16:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:16:230000.Dialogue: I'm attempting to view my work as a fleeting peripheral image so as to engage the superior colliculus of my brain.

00:00:25:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:25:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:25:190000.Dialogue: Interesting. I usually just have coffee. You've been up all night?

00:00:31:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:31:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:32:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:32:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:33:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:33:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:33:050000.Dialogue: Then I've been up all night.

00:00:37:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:37:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:38:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:38:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:38:170000.Dialogue: Why else would a person try to engage their superior colliculus?

00:00:42:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:42:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:42:140000.Dialogue: Oh, sorry, sweetie, I can't help you till I've had my coffee.

00:00:53:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:00:53:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:53:200000.Dialogue: Penny, I told you if you don't put him in his crate at night he just runs around the apartment.

00:01:00:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:00:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:01:03:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:03:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:03:170000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Hmm, he's either isolating the terms of his formula and examining them individually, or... looking for the alligator that swallowed his hand after Peter Pan cut it off.

00:01:15:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:15:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:15:200000.Dialogue: Captain Hook's hand was eaten by a crocodile, not an alligator. If you're going to mock me, at least get your facts straight.

00:01:24:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:24:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:27:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:27:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:27:230000.Dialogue: I can't see it! It just won't coalesce.

00:01:31:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:31:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:31:140000.Dialogue: Maybe you need a fresh start.

00:01:33:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:33:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:46:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is stood in the middle of the room. His whiteboard is behind him. Every few moments he turns round suddently.
00:01:46:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:46:150000.Dialogue: It's a great idea, Leonard. Thank you.

00:02:15:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:15:220000.Dialogue: Electrons move through graphene... act as if they have no mass...

00:02:22:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:22:100000.Dialogue: How long has he been stuck?

00:02:24:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:24:010000.Dialogue: Intellectually about 30 hours. Emotionally about 29 years.

00:02:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:28:050000.Dialogue: Unit cell contains two carbon atoms... Interior angle of a hexagon is 120 degrees.

00:02:43:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:43:200000.Dialogue: No, I think it's a firmware problem.

00:02:47:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:47:040000.Dialogue: Hey, it's Disco Night at the Moonlight Roller Rink in Glendale tonight. Who's up for getting down?

00:02:53:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:53:200000.Dialogue: That's perfect. Bernadette's been hocking me to take her roller skating.

00:02:58:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:58:020000.Dialogue: I think Penny likes to skate. The four of us could double.

00:03:00:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:00:220000.Dialogue: What could be better? We're in.

00:03:02:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:02:110000.Dialogue: Great. It's not like I brought it up because I wanted to go.

00:03:10:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:10:140000.Dialogue: No, it's okay. I don't have to go. I'm happy just to guide you and your ladies to suitable entertainment choices. I'm a walking brown Yelp.com.

00:03:23:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:23:050000.Dialogue: Boy, he's really gone, isn't he?

00:03:25:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:25:130000.Dialogue: Yeah, this morning he used a stick of butter as deodorant.

00:03:35:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:35:100000.Dialogue: Pattern is the same as fermions... Travels on the pathways... Hexagonal... It's always hexagonal...

00:03:39:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:39:060000.Dialogue: I haven't seen him this stuck since he tried to figure out the third Matrix movie.

00:03:46:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:46:030000.Dialogue: Hey, those are my lima beans!

00:03:52:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:52:010000.Dialogue: But if I don't eat my lima beans, I can't have my cookie.

00:03:56:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:56:230000.Dialogue: The peas- perfect. They can be electrons.

00:04:04:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:04:040000.Dialogue: What would I do with corn?

00:04:05:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:05:220000.Dialogue: So roller skating - should we all grab a bite to eat first?

00:04:09:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:09:200000.Dialogue: Good. P.F. Chang's? My mom has coupons.

00:04:12:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:12:170000.Dialogue: Great. Your mom's not coming, right?

00:04:19:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:19:140000.Dialogue: Okay, just to be clear, roller skating was my idea, and I'm very unhappy that you turned it into a double date, and I hope you both fall on your asses and break your coccyxes.

00:04:30:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:30:060000.Dialogue: The plural of coccyx is coccyges.

00:04:33:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:33:160000.Dialogue: Screw you. Give me back my lima beans.

00:04:38:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:38:220000.Dialogue: Oh, my God. Have you ever been so embarrassed?

00:04:42:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:42:220000.Dialogue: I don't know which was lamer: their roller-skating or their disco dancing.

00:04:46:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:46:200000.Dialogue: For me, the worst part was when people saw us leave with them.

00:04:52:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:52:010000.Dialogue: You had some nice moves out there, Howard.

00:05:00:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:00:170000.Dialogue: Not really. I was in my boogie zone.

00:05:05:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:05:210000.Dialogue: When Howard tried to do the splits...

00:05:09:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:09:040000.Dialogue: Sorry. I'm moving a little slow. I think I bruised my coccyx.

00:05:17:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:17:080000.Dialogue: Oh, what a gentleman. Hey, Sheldon.

00:05:20:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:20:040000.Dialogue: (screams) LEONARD: Oh, my God! Are you...

00:05:24:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:24:090000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Good Lord! You're ruining everything!

00:05:30:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:30:130000.Dialogue: Don't bark at me. I fell, too.

00:05:32:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:32:140000.Dialogue: Oh, you've been falling all night. You're used to it.

00:05:36:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:36:090000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what the hell are you doing?

00:05:38:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:38:060000.Dialogue: The same thing I've been doing for three days. Trying to figure out why electrons behave as if they have no mass when traveling through a graphene sheet.

00:05:46:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:46:090000.Dialogue: Well, I needed something bigger than peas, now, didn't I?

00:05:49:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:49:200000.Dialogue: Sheldon, when was the last time you got any sleep?

00:05:53:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:53:100000.Dialogue: I don't know- two, three days. Not important. I don't need sleep. I need answers. I need to determine where in this swamp of unbalanced formulas squatteth the toad of truth.

00:06:06:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:06:100000.Dialogue: Toad of truth? Is that a physics thing?

00:06:12:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:12:110000.Dialogue: Okay, Sheldon. What happens to our neuroreceptors when we don't get enough REM sleep?

00:06:20:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:20:220000.Dialogue: They lose their sensitivity to serotonin and norepinephrine.

00:06:28:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:28:140000.Dialogue: Right, so march in there, brush your teeth and go to bed.

00:06:32:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:32:220000.Dialogue: But I don't want to go to bed.

00:06:37:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:37:150000.Dialogue: I'm going to count to three. One...

00:06:45:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:45:030000.Dialogue: That was amazing how you handled him.

00:06:48:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:48:010000.Dialogue: I know how to deal with stubborn children. My mother used to run an illegal day care center in our basement.

00:07:06:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:06:150000.Dialogue: Leonard, you're... you're giggling in your sleep.

00:07:10:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:10:030000.Dialogue: It's not me. It's my new ringtone. The Joker from Batman.

00:07:18:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:18:030000.Dialogue: Me, too, but I paid three bucks for it.

00:07:27:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:27:190000.Dialogue: Hello. Yeah, I'm Leonard Hofstadter. Yeah, yeah, he's my roommate. Oh, God, is he okay? Yeah, all-all right. I'll be right there.

00:07:44:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:44:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon's escaped and is terrorizing the village.

00:07:55:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:55:110000.Dialogue: Hi. I'm Dr. Hofstadter. Where is he?

00:08:02:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:02:040000.Dialogue: Thanks for not calling the cops.

00:08:04:100000.Speaker: Security Guard
00:08:04:100000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, it's no big deal. My sister's got a kid who's special.

00:08:18:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:18:050000.Dialogue: Size ratio was all wrong. Couldn't visualize it. Needed bigger carbon atoms.

00:08:27:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:27:090000.Dialogue: How did you get into this place?

00:08:29:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:29:120000.Dialogue: Back door has a five-pin tumbler system, single-circuit alarm. Child's play.

00:08:35:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:35:100000.Dialogue: You can start sorting protons and neutrons while I build carbon atoms.

00:08:40:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:40:100000.Dialogue: No, I don't think so. We need to go home now.

00:08:45:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:45:150000.Dialogue: If you don't come out of there, I'm going to have to drag you out.

00:08:50:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:50:080000.Dialogue: You can try, but you'll never catch me.

00:09:27:010000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:27:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:27:010000.Dialogue: OF GAIN DET(whispering): AND FABRLeonard and Penny. Leonard and Penny. (screams)

00:09:29:170000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:29:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:36:060000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:36:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:38:060000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:38:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:40:060000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:40:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:44:180000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:44:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:46:110000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:46:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:46:110000.Dialogue: Because we didn't want to be disturbed.

00:09:48:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:48:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:48:220000.Dialogue: Well, that didn't work out, did it?

00:09:51:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:51:220000.Speaker: Penny

00:09:54:230000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:54:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:54:230000.Dialogue: I came to tell you I've got the answer.

00:09:57:170000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:09:57:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:57:170000.Dialogue: Really? You figured out the graphene problem?

00:10:01:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:01:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:01:220000.Dialogue: No, no, I'm still hopelessly stuck on that,

00:10:04:010000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:04:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:04:010000.Dialogue: but I figured out how to figure it out.

00:10:07:060000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:07:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:07:060000.Dialogue: Okay, you know what, Leonard, I know I said I could handle your roommate, but I was wrong. We're going to have to break up.

00:10:12:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:12:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:14:230000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:14:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:10:18:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:18:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:20:030000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:20:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:20:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, I'm going to need a little more.

00:10:23:040000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:23:040000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:27:220000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:27:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:30:060000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:30:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:30:060000.Dialogue: When Albert Einstein came up with special relativity, he was working at the patent office.

00:10:34:200000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:34:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:34:200000.Dialogue: So, you're going to go work at the patent office?

00:10:37:100000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:37:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:37:100000.Dialogue: Don't be absurd. That's in Washington. You know I could never live in a city whose streets are laid out in a wheel-and-spoke pattern. No. I'm going to find a similarly menial job where my basal ganglia are occupied with a routine task, freeing my prefrontal cortex to work quietly in the background on my problem.

00:10:56:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:56:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:57:230000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:10:57:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:57:230000.Dialogue: Of course it is. Even talking to you is sufficiently menial that I can feel the proverbial juices starting to flow.

00:11:03:160000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:11:03:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:03:160000.Dialogue: Okay, well, thanks for sharing with us. Good night.

00:11:06:110000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:11:06:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:06:110000.Dialogue: You're welcome. And good night to you, too. Oh, by the way, I was watching you sleep for a moment, and I noticed that your snoring seems to be worse when you're on your back.

00:11:17:200000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:11:17:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:19:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:11:19:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:19:190000.Dialogue: No, I wasn't talking to Leonard.

00:11:24:100000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon is standing over their bed. He knocks on the wall.
00:11:24:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:28:060000.Speaker: Employment Office Assistant
00:11:28:060000.Dialogue: So, Mr. Cooper, you're looking for a job.

00:11:38:040000.Speaker: Assistant
00:11:38:040000.Dialogue: Why, thank you for noticing. I'm "Menial Employee of the Month."

00:11:45:160000.Speaker: Assistant
00:11:45:160000.Dialogue: Do you have a particular field in mind?

00:11:48:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:48:010000.Dialogue: I do. For thousands of years, the lowest classes of the human race have spent their lives laboring to erect monuments under the lash of their betters, until finally, they dropped down and became one with the dust through which they trudged. Do you have anything like that?

00:12:21:010000.Speaker: Assistant
00:12:21:010000.Dialogue: I didn't really have to. So, how about construction?

00:12:26:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:26:100000.Dialogue: Oh, that would be good! Sawing, hammering, eating out of a lunch pail as my working-class fellows and I sit perched precariously on a girder high above the metropolis.

00:12:38:050000.Speaker: Assistant
00:12:38:050000.Dialogue: No, no. This is putting up sheetrock at a housing project in Rosemead.

00:12:53:050000.Speaker: Assistant
00:12:53:050000.Dialogue: How about doing deliveries for a florist?

00:13:04:040000.Speaker: Assistant
00:13:04:040000.Dialogue: Mr. Cooper, let me just ask you a question. What was your last job?

00:13:08:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:08:220000.Dialogue: Senior theoretical particle physicist at CalTech, focusing on M theory, or, in layman's terms, string theory.

00:13:15:040000.Speaker: Assistant
00:13:15:040000.Dialogue: I see. Just give me a second. Security!

00:13:30:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:30:180000.Dialogue: Okay, I'll get those drinks started for you.

00:13:37:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:37:050000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what the hell are you doing?

00:13:39:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:39:110000.Dialogue: I'm trying to get these tables cleared. We're slammed.

00:13:43:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:43:110000.Dialogue: No, wait, wait, no, wait. Wh-What are you doing here?

00:13:46:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:46:210000.Dialogue: A reasonable question. I asked myself, what is the most mind-numbing, pedestrian job conceivable, and three answers came to mind: uh, toll booth attendant, Apple Store genius...

00:13:59:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:59:150000.Dialogue: ...and what Penny does. Now... since I don't like touching other people's coins, and I refuse to contribute to the devaluation of the word "genius," here I am.

00:14:12:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:12:140000.Dialogue: You just, you just walked in and they hired you, just like that?

00:14:16:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:16:200000.Dialogue: Oh, heavens, no. Since I don't need to be paid, I didn't need to be hired. I simply came in, picked up a tray, and started "working for the man."

00:14:25:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:25:130000.Dialogue: Let me get that plate out of your way.

00:14:29:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:29:220000.Dialogue: Is it? Just a moment ago, I had a minor epiphany regarding the polymer degradation phenomenon while scraping congealed nachos off a plate. Bernadette, table 10 wants their check.

00:14:41:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:41:010000.Dialogue: Sheldon, wait, this isn't even what I do. I'm a waitress, not a busboy.

00:14:45:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:45:040000.Dialogue: You're right. That is more menial. Hello, I'm Sheldon. I'll be your server today.

00:14:52:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:52:150000.Dialogue: I don't recommend the salmon. I saw it in the kitchen.

00:14:59:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:59:020000.Dialogue: All right, one bacon cheeseburger, breaking two Jewish dietary restrictions simultaneously- kudos. Beer-battered fish and chips. Now, here's your tartar sauce. I also brought you salsa. It's a little unconventional, but I think you'll like it. It's zingy.

00:15:18:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:18:220000.Dialogue: And for you, Factory Burrito Grande- no cheese, no sour cream, no ugly consequences from your lactose intolerance.

00:15:29:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:29:160000.Dialogue: Hang on. Black beans, not pinto beans?

00:15:37:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:37:210000.Dialogue: You understand why I'm doing this to you?

00:15:47:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:47:060000.Dialogue: How long can he keep this up?

00:15:49:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:49:060000.Dialogue: I heard about this professor at MIT who melted down, bought a van, and spent the rest of his life as a mobile dog groomer.

00:15:55:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:55:020000.Dialogue: He never went back to the university?

00:15:56:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:56:220000.Dialogue: Only to shampoo Professor Shamburg's shih tzu.

00:16:04:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:04:080000.Dialogue: I bet if we all chipped in, we could buy Sheldon a van.

00:16:10:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:10:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's the only thing wrong with that plan.

00:16:14:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:14:080000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, sorry you had to wait, but we are swamped. What's this?

00:16:23:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:23:150000.Dialogue: Well, honey, not to complain, but we were starting to think you didn't either.

00:16:34:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:34:230000.Dialogue: Good Lord. The interference pattern in the fracture. The motion of the wave through the molecular structure. I've been looking at it all wrong. I can't consider the electrons as particles. They move through the graphene as a wave. It's a wave!

00:16:56:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:56:140000.Dialogue: The moment to applaud would be now.

00:17:04:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:04:000000.Dialogue: Sheldon... where are you going? Aren't you going to clean this up?

00:17:07:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:07:040000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I don't work here.
